abstract: Jaime and Daisy Johnson, daughters of New York Jets owner Robert Wood Johnson IV and heiresses to the Johnson & Johnson company, describe how their professional interests in photography helped them heal after the well-publicized death of their older sister Casey Johnson in 2010.
snippet: After losing their sister, the surviving Johnson sisters closed ranks and chose to immerse themselves in work.
lead_paragraph: After losing their sister, the surviving Johnson sisters closed ranks and chose to immerse themselves in work.

headline.main: Trying to Outrun Wealth and Fame
headline.print_headline: Trying to Outrun Wealth and Fame
headline.seo: Trying to Outrun Wealth and Fame
